column4: is yours to high, or?  mine is at 20-40 % right now, but im having 8 bittorrent downloads with bittornade running (and other applications such as epiphany, xchat, gaim etc).
my settles in at about 25%....with only xchat and gnome terminal running along with gnome monitor
and you are sure you have not set gnome monitor to update every 0.5 seconds or something? otherwise it seems like a to high figure :(
nope i've not changed any settings there
what process is taking so much?
wish I knew
change to show all processes, and then you should have a columns for % of cpu in the list. (hopefully, i am running Hoary the unstable branch of Ubuntu so it might have changed)
yeah i've got all processes and X spikes sometimes to 20% or so....no idea whats causing it as its doing it with both 2.6.10 and 2.6.8 kernels so that isn't it...using warty btw
have you installed either nvidia och ati's drivers for 3d? if so, try to remove them and see if it continues..?
either I try upgrading to hoary or I reinstall I guess ;(
yes I use nvidia....6111
if you choose to either reinstall or upgrade, i would first spend some time upgrading. it might help, and for me Hoary now is stable (but there is no guerantee..)
8 bittorrents eh ;-)...busy man heh
yup exactly
its tempting yes...I just fear after threee hours I might be left with unuseable system anyway LOL..shrug
so after upgrade you still could login to desktop

i would actually try to remove the nvidia driver first if i was you.  That might help. Just remove the package, and make *sure* you are not loading the nvidia kernel-module, and that you use "nv" and not "nvidia" as the driver for X. (if you know howto,..?)
yes. but i could not use the nvidia driver. I dont know why, but X gets crazy then. I have an old tnt2-card, so i dont get much 3d anyway so i dont mind using the free driver.
I suppose its worth a shot...nv would be okay for a test yes
since it seems like its X that causes the CPU overload (if i read correctly) i would start with the drivers for X :)
did you meen that you was hoping for a gui to format floppys? if so, there is one.
